alert.note: Alert for Limestone (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 23 at 8:45PM CST until February 24 at 9:00PM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Alabama...Tennessee... Elk River Near Prospect affecting Giles and Limestone Counties. For the Elk River...including Prospect...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Elk River Near Prospect. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 24.5 feet, Water begins to approach Veto Rd near the Hargrove - Johnson bridge. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 PM CST Wednesday the stage was 23.7 feet and falling. - Forecast...The river is expected to continue falling through tomorrow. - Action stage is 22.0 feet. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday evening at 815 PM CST.
